channel.title: Oracle® Database, 12c Release 1 (12.1.0.2) New and Updated Books
channel.description: This feed shows new and updated items. You will see links to all available items the first time you view it. After subscribing and marking items read, new and updated items will appear as unread.
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2017, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

item.title: Oracle® Database Administrator's Reference for Linux and UNIX-Based Operating Systems
item.description: Explains how to configure and manage Oracle Database on Linux and UNIX-based operating systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Platform Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides platform-specific information for configuring and using Oracle Database software on the Windows platform. Topics discussed include: architecture, services, tools, configuration, administration, tuning, backup, accounts, passwords, user authentication, registry parameters, and application development.

item.title: Oracle® Database Data Cartridge Developer's Guide
item.description: Describes how to implement custom indexing and query optimization services and how to package and use these as a server extension called a data cartridge.

item.title: Oracle® Database Advanced Queuing Java API Reference
item.description: Describes the Java APIs for application development and integration using the Oracle messaging system, Advanced Queuing.

item.title: Oracle® Database XML Java API Reference
item.description: Describes Java APIs for XML.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Security Guide
item.description: Provides an introduction to securing an Oracle database using the default security features, such as how to secure the database installation and configuration or manage encryption. It includes beginning level tutorials for creating secure application roles, Oracle Database Vault policies, Oracle Virtual Private Database policies, Oracle Data Redaction policies, Oracle Label Security policies, and unified auditing policies.

item.title: Oracle® Database Net Services Administrator's Guide
item.description: Explains how to plan, configure, and manage enterprise-wide connectivity with Oracle Net Services.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Real Application Clusters Guide
item.description: Describes how to install, configure, and administer Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) on a two-node system using the Oracle Linux operating system.

item.title: Oracle® Database RAC FAN Events Java API Reference
item.description: Provides easy access to Oracle Fast Application Notification (FAN) events.

item.title: Oracle® OLAP DML Reference
item.description: Contains a complete description of the OLAP Data Manipulation Language (OLAP DML) used to define and manipulate analytic workspace objects.

item.title: Oracle® Data Mining Concepts
item.description: Discusses the basic concepts underlying Oracle Data Mining. Includes an overview of the features of Oracle Data Mining and information about mining functions and algorithms.

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia objects to manage multimedia content within Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia DICOM Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using the Oracle Multimedia object designed to store Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) data within Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Mid-Tier Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia to extract Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) metadata outside of the database, either on the client or in the middle tier.

item.title: Oracle® Data Provider for .NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes provider-specific features and properties of ODP.NET. Oracle Data Provider for .NET is an implementation of Microsoft's ADO.NET interface and provides access to Oracle databases.

item.title: Oracle® Providers for ASP.NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides introductory, installation, postinstallation configuration, and usage information for using these providers with ASP.NET services and controls.

item.title: Oracle® Database XStream Java API Reference
item.description: Describes the Java APIs for XStream.

item.title: Oracle® Database Heterogeneous Connectivity User's Guide
item.description: Describes Oracle's approach to information integration in a heterogeneous environment. Describes Oracle Database Gateways and is a user's guide for these Oracle products.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for SQL Server User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for SQL Server, which enables Oracle client applications to access SQL Server data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Release Notes
item.description: Contains important information not included in the documentation for Oracle Application Express.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Installation Guide
item.description: Provides an overview of installing Oracle Application Express and describes issues to consider before installing.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Application Express Developer's Guide
item.description: Introduces you to application development using Oracle Application Express. This manual shows you how to set up a development environment, or access a hosted demonstration environment. It then walks you through building an initial application, modifying it, and previewing it.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Application Builder User's Guide
item.description: Describes how to use the Oracle Application Express development environment to build and deploy database-centric Web applications.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Application Migration Guide
item.description: Describes how to convert applications from either Microsoft Access or Oracle Forms to Oracle Application Express.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express API Reference
item.description: Describes the Application Programming Interfaces, referred to as APIs, available when programming in the Oracle Application Express environment.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express SQL Workshop Guide
item.description: Describes how to use Oracle Application Express SQL Workshop and utilities to load and unload data from an Oracle database, generate DDL, view object reports, and restore dropped database objects.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Administration Guide
item.description: Describes how to perform administration tasks for an Oracle Application Express workspace, application, or an entire development instance.

item.title: Oracle® Database Advanced Replication Management API Reference
item.description: Contains reference information about and step-by-step instructions for using the replication management API, which is a set of PL/SQL packages for setting up and managing an Advanced Replication environment. It also includes reference information about data dictionary views that are important for Advanced Replication and security considerations for an Advanced Replication environment.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache Introduction
item.description: Describes the features of TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache and provides information to help developers plan a TimesTen Cache application.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Installation Guide
item.description: Provides information about installing and upgrading the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache User's Guide
item.description: Provides information about designing and configuring the TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache. It includes information about setting up a cache grid.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Replication Guide
item.description: Provides information about designing and configuring TimesTen to TimesTen replication, including information about TimesTen integration with Oracle Clusterware.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Troubleshooting Guide
item.description: Provides information about utilities and procedures for troubleshooting problems that may be encountered when using the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database C Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information about developing C applications to access the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database through ODBC. It also includes information about TimesTen support for XLA, OCI, and the Pro*C/C++ Precompiler.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Java Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information about developing Java applications to access the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database through JDBC. It also includes information about support for TimesTen JMS/XLA.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database PL/SQL Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information about using PL/SQL with the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database TTClasses Guide
item.description: Describes how to use the TimesTen C++ Interface Classes (TTClasses) library.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database SQL Reference
item.description: Provides a reference for SQL statements, expressions, and functions used with the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database, including TimesTen SQL extensions. It also describes data types.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Reference
item.description: Provides a reference for attributes, built-in procedures, utilities, and system limits for the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database System Tables and Views Reference
item.description: Describes TimesTen system tables and replication tables.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database PL/SQL Packages Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for packages provided with TimesTen PL/SQL.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database JDBC Extensions Java API Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for TimesTen JDBC classes and interfaces.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database JMS/XLA Java API Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for TimesTen JMS/XLA classes and interfaces.

item.title: Oracle® OLAP Expression Syntax Reference
item.description: Describes the Oracle OLAP expression syntax used to generate information-rich content from the data stored in dimensional database objects such as cubes and cube dimensions.

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Servlets and JSP Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Java servlets and JavaServer Pages (JSP) to retrieve and upload multimedia data from and to Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express End User Guide
item.description: Explains common Oracle Application Express end user tasks.

item.title: Oracle® SQL Developer User's Guide
item.description: Provides conceptual and usage information about Oracle SQL Developer, a graphical tool that enables you to browse, create, edit, and delete (drop) database objects; run SQL statements and scripts; edit and debug PL/SQL code; manipulate and export data; migrate third-party databases to Oracle; view metadata and data in third-party databases; and view and create reports.Note: This book is for an old release of SQL Developer. You are encouraged to use the latest available release. See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/developer-tools/sql-developer/ for information about downloads and documentation.

item.title: Oracle® Globalization Development Kit Java API Reference
item.description: Describes APIs for the Oracle Globalization Development Kit.

item.title: Oracle® Automatic Storage Management Administrator's Guide
item.description: Describes how to administer Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM) for Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Database SQL Language Reference
item.description: Contains a complete description of Oracle SQL, the language used to manage information in Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Database Concepts
item.description: Describes Oracle Database architecture and essential topics for database administrators and developers.

item.title: Oracle® Database Upgrade Guide
item.description: Guides you through the process of planning and performing upgrades for Oracle Database. This book also provides information about compatibility, upgrading applications, and changes in the new release that affect upgrading Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Text Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for building applications with Oracle Text.

item.title: Oracle® Database Administrator's Guide
item.description: Describes how to create, configure, and administer an Oracle database. Includes sections on Oracle Scheduler, Oracle Database Resource Manager, Oracle Restart, Pluggable Databases, and distributed computing.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for Linux
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Database Utilities
item.description: Describes how to use Oracle Database utilities to load data into a database, transfer data between databases, and maintain data. The topics discussed include Data Pump Export, Data Pump Import, SQL*Loader, external tables and associated access drivers, the Automatic Diagnostic Repository Command Interpreter (ADRCI), DBVERIFY, DBNEWID, LogMiner, the Metadata API, original Export, and original Import.

item.title: Oracle® Database Globalization Support Guide
item.description: Describes Oracle globalization support for the database. Explains how to set up a globalization support environment, choose and migrate a character set, customize locale data, do linguistic sorting, program in a global environment, and program with Unicode.

item.title: Oracle® Database Data Warehousing Guide
item.description: Provides conceptual, reference, and implementation material for using Oracle Database in data warehousing. It covers the full range of data warehousing activities, from physical database design to advanced calculation techniques.

item.title: Oracle® Database Security Guide
item.description: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use the default security features.

item.title: Oracle® Database Real Application Security Java API Reference
item.description: Documents two Java packages: - oracle.security.xs contains the APIs for using lightweight user sessions - oracle.security.xs.admin contains the APIs for administering lightweight user session.

item.title: Oracle® Data Guard Broker
item.description: Describes the Oracle Data Guard broker, a management and monitoring interface that automates many of the tasks involved in configuring and monitoring standby databases in an Oracle Data Guard configuration.

item.title: Oracle® Label Security Administrator's Guide
item.description: Explains how to configure and use Oracle Label Security, which provides row-level access control based on the virtual private database technology of Oracle Database Enterprise Edition.

item.title: Oracle® Database Migration Assistant for Unicode Guide
item.description: Introduces you to the Oracle Database Migration Assistant for Unicode, discusses the database character set migration process, and verifies that there are no character set data problems in a current Unicode database.

item.title: Oracle® Data Guard Concepts and Administration
item.description: Provides a comprehensive overview of Oracle Data Guard concepts and describes how to configure and implement standby databases that can take over production operations if your production database becomes unusable. This guide includes several database scenarios such as creating, recovering, failing over, switching over, configuring, and backing up standby and primary databases.

item.title: Oracle® Clusterware Administration and Deployment Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Clusterware architecture and provides an overview of this product. This book also describes administrative and deployment topics for Oracle Clusterware.

item.title: Oracle® Real Application Clusters Administration and Deployment Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) architecture and provides an overview of this product. This book also describes administrative and deployment topics for Oracle RAC.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Linux
item.description: Describes how to install Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Real Application Clusters Installation Guide for Linux and UNIX
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) on systems running Linux and UNIX.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes how to install grid infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Microsoft Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Real Application Clusters Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Real Application Clusters on the Microsoft Windows platform.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quality of Service Management User's Guide
item.description: Describes the concepts of Oracle Database Quality of Service Management (Oracle Database QoS Management), and explains how to configure, administer, and troubleshoot Oracle Database QoS Management.

item.title: Oracle® Database Performance Tuning Guide
item.description: Provides information about how to tune the performance of Oracle Database using Oracle performance tools.

item.title: Oracle® Database SQL Tuning Guide
item.description: Describes how to perform SQL tuning, which is the iterative process of improving SQL statement performance to meet specific, measurable, and achievable goals.

item.title: Oracle® Database Vault Administrator's Guide
item.description: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use Oracle Database Vault, which enables users to restrict and monitor administrative user access.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial and Graph GeoRaster Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information for the GeoRaster feature of Oracle Spatial and Graph, which lets you store, index, query, analyze, and deliver raster data (raster image and gridded data and its associated metadata).

item.title: Oracle® Spatial and Graph Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information for indexing and storing spatial data and for developing spatial applications using Oracle Spatial and Graph and Oracle Locator.

item.title: Oracle® Database New Features Guide
item.description: Oracle Database New Features Guide is addressed to those of you familiar with previous releases of Oracle Database and who would like to become familiar with features, options, and enhancements that are new in this release of the database.

item.title: Oracle® Database Error Messages Reference
item.description: Describes error messages that may appear while using products that are part of Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Database Advanced Security Guide
item.description: Explains how to configure and use Oracle Database Advanced Security Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) and Oracle Data Redaction.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial and Graph Java API Reference
item.description: Provides Javadoc-generated information about interfaces and classes that support features available with Oracle Spatial and Graph, including GeoRaster and the Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph features, and with MapViewer, which is packaged with Oracle Fusion Middleware.

item.title: Oracle® Database Backup and Recovery User's Guide
item.description: Explains how to use Recovery Manager (RMAN) to back up, recover, and duplicate a database, and how to use Oracle Flashback Technology to restore all or a portion of your data to a previous state.

item.title: Oracle® Database Backup and Recovery Reference
item.description: Provides detailed descriptions of the Recovery Manager (RMAN) commands and recovery catalog views.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on Oracle Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Oracle Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to install Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a Cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running HP-UX Itanium.

item.title: Oracle® Database Real Application Security Session Service Java API Reference
item.description: Documents one Java package: - oracle.security.xs.ee.session contains the APIs for using an application session service.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Linux
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Database Migration Assistant for Unicode Release Notes
item.description: Contains late-breaking information for Oracle Database Migration Assistant for Unicode.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial and Graph RDF Semantic Graph Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information about Oracle Database support for semantic technologies, including storage, inference, and query capabilities for data and ontologies based on Resource Description Framework (RDF), RDF Schema (RDFS), and Web Ontology Language (OWL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Contains important information not included in Oracle Database documentation for Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Contains important information not included in Oracle Database documentation for AIX.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Contains information that was not included in the platform-specific or product-specific documentation for this release.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Contains important information not included in Oracle Database documentation for Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on HP-UX systems.

item.title: Oracle® Data Mining User's Guide
item.description: Explains how to use the SQL interface to Oracle Data Mining to create models and score data. This Guide also addresses administrative issues such as security, import/export, and upgrade for Oracle Data Mining.

item.title: Oracle® Database Advanced Replication
item.description: Contains conceptual information about Oracle Database Advanced Replication. It also includes information about planning an Advanced Replication environment and information about troubleshooting Advanced Replication problems.

item.title: Oracle® Database XStream Guide
item.description: Contains conceptual information about XStream. Also contains instructions for configuring and using XStream.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial and Graph Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information about the Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph features of Oracle Spatial and Graph.

item.title: Pro*COBOL® Programmer's Guide
item.description: Describes how to develop COBOL programs that use the database languages SQL and PL/SQL to access and manipulate Oracle data.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86-64
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Linux x86-64 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Performance Tuning Guide
item.description: Explains how to perform day-to-day database performance tuning tasks using features provided by Oracle Diagnostics Pack, Oracle Tuning Pack, and Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for Linux
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database client on Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86-64
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Linux x86-64 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Oracle Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Universal Connection Pool for JDBC Java API Reference
item.description: Provides Java API reference for Universal Connection Pool for JDBC.

item.title: Oracle® Database JDBC Java API Reference
item.description: Provides Java API reference for Java Database connectivity.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on HP-UX Itanium systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on HP-UX Itanium.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on System z
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Z/Linux systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on System z
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Z/Linux systems.

item.title: Oracle® Enterprise Manager for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database User's Guide
item.description: Describes how to install the Oracle Enterprise Manager Plug-in for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® Enterprise Manager for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database Release Notes
item.description: Provides late-breaking information about the Oracle Enterprise Manager Plug-in for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® Data Masking and Subsetting Guide
item.description: Provides information about how to manage data using the Oracle Data Masking and Subsetting features of the Enterprise Manager for Oracle Database Plug-in.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on POWER Big Endian Systems
item.description: This guide provides instructions about installing and configuring Oracle Database Client for Linux on POWER Systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Release Notes for IBM: Linux on POWER Big Endian Systems
item.description: This document contains important information that was not included in the platform-specific or product-specific documentation for this release.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on POWER Little Endian Systems
item.description: This guide provides instructions about installing and configuring Oracle Database Client for Linux on POWER Systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Release Notes for IBM: Linux on POWER Little Endian Systems
item.description: This document contains important information that was not included in the platform-specific or product-specific documentation for this release.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation and Administration Guide for Fujitsu BS2000/OSD
item.description: Explains how to install, upgrade, and manage Oracle Database on Fujitsu BS2000/OSD systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Instant Client Installation Guide for Apple Mac OS X (Intel)
item.description: This guide provides instructions about installing and configuring Oracle Database Instant Client for Apple Mac OS X (Intel).

item.title: Oracle® Database Instant Client Release Notes for Apple Mac OS X (Intel)
item.description: This document contains important information about platform-specific documentation for this release.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Fujitsu BS2000/OSD
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for Fujitsu.
